riddle: if 2 is company and 3 is a crowd, what are 4 and 5?
This thing all things devours; birds, beasts, trees, flowers; gnaws iron, bites steel; grinds hard stones to meal; slays king, ruins town, and beats mountain down.
Alive without breath, as cold as death; Never thirsty, ever drinking, all in mail never clinking
It cannot be seen, cannot be felt, cannot be heard, cannot be smelt. It lies behind stars and under hills, and empty holes it fills.  It comes out first and follows after.  Ends life, kills laughter
Voiceless it cries, wingless it flutters, toothless bites, mouthless mutters.
What has roots as nobody sees, is taller than trees, up, up it goes, and yet never grows?

i am an odd number. take away a letter and i become even. what number am i?

forward, i am heavy; backward, i am not. what am i?

what has hands but cannot clap?
what gets broken without being held?
poor people have it. rich people need it. if you eat it you die. what is it?
what kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
they come out at night without being called, and are lost in the day without being stolen. what are they?
what is always in front of you, but can’t be seen?
i can be cracked, made, told, and played. what am i?
i cannot talk, but i always reply when spoken to. what am i?
i love to dance, and twist. i shake my tail as i sail away. when i fly wingless into the sky. what am i?
when you stop to look, you can always see me. but if you try to touch me, you can never feel me. although you walk towards me, i remain the same distance from you. what am i?
what is it that no one wants to have, but no one wants to lose either?
what goes through cities and fields, but never moves?
what can go through glass without breaking it?
what gets bigger the more you take away?
i have no life, but i can die. what am i?
what kind of room has no walls, door or windows?
i make a loud sound when i’m changing. when i do change, i get bigger but weigh less. what am i?
it has keys, but no locks. it has space, but no room. you can enter, but can’t go inside. what is it?
i’m orange, i wear a green hat and i sound like a parrot. what am i?

take off my skin - i won't cry, but you will! what am i?

what is always on its way but never arrives?

what has many teeth but cannot bite?

where is the only place where today comes before yesterday?

what is full of holes but still holds water?

which word becomes shorter when you add 2 letters to it?

once you are given one, you either have two or none?
sarcastic-response: ...but...then you'd have 2 (except for special cases).  Get yer mind outta the gutter!

riddle: i am never scared but became petrified and can’t live in a house but would die to make one. what am i?

my thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. what am i?

better old than young; the healthier it is, the smaller it will be.
better old than young; the healthier it is, the smaller it will be.

what is it that you keep when you need it not, but throw out when you do need it?
forty white horses on a red hill. they champ, they stamp, and then stand still.

i can fly like a bird not in the sky, which can always swim and can always dry. i say goodbye at night and morning hi. i'm part of you what am i. i follow and lead as you pass, dress yourself in black my darkness lasts. i flee the light but without the sun, your view of me would be gone.
brought to the table. cut and served. never eaten.
it can pierce the best armor, and make swords crumble with a rub. yet for all its power, it can't harm a club.
passed from father to son, and shared between brothers. its importance is unquestioned, though it is used more by others.
today he is there to trip you up, and he will torture you tomorrow. yet he is also there to ease the pain, when you are lost in grief and sorrow.
in the form of fork or sheet, i hit the ground. and if you wait a heartbeat, you can hear my roaring sound.
i have no tears but i perspire, i stretch but cannot respire, i can jump, walk, run and dance, though i have no mind. i'll take a stance. what am i?
i can bring down the mightiest of men. nobody can defy me. i am the enemy of flight. yet you can’t even sense my presence. what am i?

i am green with envy when i am placed below the sky. i do not breathe the air you breathe but i never wonder why. if you go and shelter me, i simply shrink and die. the answer to this riddle is simply who am i?
if i'm in front i don't matter, if i'm in back i make everything be more, i am something yet i am nothing. what am i?
poke your fingers in my eyes and i will open wide my jaws. linen cloth, quills or paper, all will split before my might. what am i?
what happens once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?

when set loose i fly away, never so cursed as when i go astray.
lighter than what i am made of, more of me is hidden than is seen.
glittering points that downward thrust, sparkling spears that never rust.
three lives have i. gentle enough to soothe the skin, light enough to caress the sky, hard enough to crack rocks.
